name: Bowslinger
description: Ever wanted to shoot an apple off someone’s head? Step into the world of Bowslinger, a VR archery game for the Vive. Grab a bow & arrow and William Tell your way to becoming a master archer. Train your speed and precision with various challenges that would make Robin Hood himself jealous!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 SP1, Windows 8.1, or Windows 10 Processor: Intel® i5-4590 / AMD FX 8350 equivalent or greater Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce® GTX 970 / AMD Radeon™ R9 290 equivalent or greater Storage: 100 MB available space

reviews.review_text: This game is every bit as fun as it looks (if not more)!!  If you've ever shot a bow before, the aiming sensation is surprisingly accurate to the real thing. The feel of whipping an arrow out of my quiver, slapping it on the rest, and drawing back the string all in a fraction of a second is incredibly satisfying! Makes me think I'm a bona fide archery master :)  My friends and I have had a ton of fun switching off and just trying to outdo each other with trick shots in the playground mode. When you attach the spectator camera to the arrow and finally peg that apple out of mid air.... mhmmm, such satisfaction!

I really enjoy VR archery games and bought this without hesitation. Unfortunately, there's not a lot to it, and even though I really like VR archery I got bored pretty quickly. The devs claimed they were working on an action mode, but now are totally silent on the subject, so there's not much to recommend at present. At least it's cheap.

Tried to shoot an apple off a dude's head, killed the dude instead, RIP :^(  Needs more types of bows and green suits so I can feel like Mr Queen :^)  In all seriousness though it's pretty juddery on the recommended specs, so it needs fixing before it can really be playable.

Its a shame that Bowslinger does not provide more variation.  What it does do is get the fundamentals right; the bow mechanics are good. Threre's something about hearing the early stages of The William Tell Overture played too...  It's not that it is a bad game but there are other archery games on VR which provide more of a dynamic challenge.  For now its a thumbs down.
